name: TerraformRunner
description: Perform tasks using Hashicorp's Terraform Infrastructure Management Tool!
author: Jacob Cleaveland

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The directory from which to run Terraform commands. Defaults to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: terraformCommands
inputs.label: Terraform Commands
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A list of Terraform commands, one per line.
If using the AzureCLI Provider Credentials option, `terraform init` will be run for you.

inputs.name: useAzureCliAuth
inputs.label: Use AzureCLI for Terraform AzureRM Provider Credentials?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Checking this enables using the cross-platform AzureCLI to authenticate with the AzureRM Terraform provider.

inputs.name: terraformAzureProviderCredentials
inputs.label: Azure Resource Manager Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the Azure Resource Manager credentials to use with your Terraform AzureRM Provider.

inputs.name: useAzureTerraformBackend
inputs.label: Use Azure Storage Terraform Backend?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Checking this enables using the cross-platform AzureCLI to authenticate with the AzureRM Terraform provider.

inputs.name: terraformAzureBackendCredentials
inputs.label: Azure Resource Manager Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the Azure Resource Manager credentials to use with your Terraform AzureRM Provider.

inputs.name: terraformStateStorageAccount
inputs.label: Azure storage account used for Terraform remote state backend.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Azure storage account that is currently being used to host the Terraform remote state backend for this run.

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the container where the remote state files are stored.

inputs.name: stateFileName
inputs.label: Terraform state file name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the remote state file to use.
